intro: Ornithoxanthum bohemicum, commonly known as the Bohemian ornithoxanthum, is a rare flowering plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in woodland edges or meadows. Its flowers are composed of ray florets and tubular disc florets, typical of the daisy family. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
